definition: to immobilize with a lasso/to be trapped in the stock market

to cover/to encase/cover/sheath/to overlap/to interleave/to model after/to copy/formula/harness/loop of rope/(fig.) to fish for/to obtain slyly/classifier for sets, collections/bend (of a river or mountain range, in place names)/tau (Greek letter Ττ)

sentences.english: The reason is based on what economists call “the hold up problem.”
sentences.chinese: 原因就在於被經濟人士稱爲的“套牢問題”。

sentences.english: The best way to hold a man is in your arms.
sentences.chinese: 要套牢一個男人最好的方法是把他抱在懷中。

sentences.english: The hold up problem is particularly severe in the IT sector.
sentences.chinese: 套牢問題在IT領域尤爲嚴重。

sentences.english: When I love somebody, I feel sort of trapped.
sentences.chinese: 每當墜入愛河，我多少會有點被套牢的感覺。

sentences.english: Therefore, open source is an economically powerful solution to the hold up problem.
sentences.chinese: 因此，開源是對付套牢問題的強大廉價解決方案。

sentences.english: Investors are seeing good opportunities to buy, and that could be as a sign of potential capitulation as well.
sentences.chinese: 投資者看到好機會去購買，但同時也可能被套牢。

sentences.english: Programming languages and software development platforms are particularly at risk of hold up.
sentences.chinese: 編程語言和軟件開發平臺有着特別大的被套牢風險。

sentences.english: Even just to buy on the hold-up, if we find a mistake, it should sell.
sentences.chinese: 即便是剛買進就套牢，如果發現錯了，也應賣出。

sentences.english: Once hooked, a woman becomes a cow.
sentences.chinese: 一旦被套牢了，女人就變成了一頭牛。

definition: quilt cover/to have money stuck (in stocks, real estate etc)
to agree to pay compensation/to accept liability
